We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

title: Customer Service Team Manager
description:
**About The Role**
 Exciting opportunities await as we are seeking a Customer Service Team Manager for Sweden at Instabee. In this key position, you will lead the department and operations within your area of responsibility, aligning with Instabee's long-term strategies and goals. Our team is continuously growing, so this position will be the fourth Team Manager role within the Customer service team.
   

  

 At Instabee, we have our consumers at heart, and we are dedicated to providing them with the best possible experience. This role involves active collaboration with other stakeholders at the company to share knowledge and achieve our objectives.
   

  

****Some of the things you will do****
* Lead and coach your team in their respective assignments within the Customer Service team.
* Ensure that all agents in your team give the best service in all interactions with our consumers.
* Managing quality of customer service via QA, training, and quality controls.
* Ensure compliance with the business's processes based on the business's needs, goals and central guidelines.
* Ensure that the organisation within its area of responsibility has the right resources and competencies to carry out the set goals.
* Handle labor law questions with the other Team Managers and with help from our local HR business partner.


**Your future team**
 We embrace change, innovation and having fun while working together towards shared goals. If you're looking for an engaging and inspiring work environment where you can make a real impact, this is the place for you!
   

  

**What We're Looking For**
* Excellent leadership, problem-solving and time management.
* Strive for continuous improvement.
* Be a motivating leader who thrive on developing both people and processes.
* Have at least six years of experience working in Customer Service or similar roles, where you have a lot of interactions with consumers.
* Have at least two years of experience in leading a team.
* Be able to cooperate with other Team Managers to reach the department's goals.
* Previous experience and success with leading, managing, developing and coaching high performing teams.
* Fluent in Swedish and English.


 If this is you, we can’t wait to meet you!
   

  

**What You’ll Get**
 We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like changes and want to set new processes and ways of working - this is the place for you!
   

  

**Benefits**
 Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:
   

  

* 🌇 Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
* 🐶 Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
* 🏓 Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
* 👶 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care and love to your little one.
* 🎂 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!


 Diversity and inclusion is very important to us and we are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We want to be a workplace where everyone’s perspectives and opinions are valued, and we are dedicated to creating opportunities for all employees to thrive and reach their full potential.
   

  

**Get to know us**
 In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the consumer at heart.
   

  

 We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for you to help us on the journey ahead.
   

  

*This recruitment process consists of background checks via Verifiera as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes at Instabee in Sweden.*
 Instabee was founded in 2022 after combining Budbee and Instabox — two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox and Porterbuddy. Instabee is present in six countries, serving thousands of online merchants, including ASOS, Zalando, Inditex and H&M and is on track to become the most admired European e-commerce enabler.
   

  

 Since the start, Instabee has focused on consumer-centric and sustainable solutions, offering deliveries to boxes and homes using muscle power, electricity, renewable diesel and biofuels. Through bespoke technical solutions, Instabee can guarantee optimal fill rates and routing, minimising any unnecessary transports. Instabee is backed by Kinnevik, Creades and EQT, among others.

title: Director, People Partnerships
Recruiter
description:
Are you looking for a new challenge where you can showcase your recruiting expertise and make an impact? Do you have a knack for spotting top talent and a passion for building strong teams? We need you to drive our recruitment success!
   

  

 We are now looking for a motivated Recruiter to join our team at DeLaval, a company committed to sustainable food production.
   

  

**Role And Responsibilities**
 As a Recruiter you will handle end-to-end recruitment processes, working closely with hiring managers and HR colleagues. You will help attract and recruit talented individuals who will contribute to our mission. Your stakeholders will include managers from all departments in DeLaval in Sweden, and you will recruit a wide range of roles including software engineers, mechanical engineers, IT specialists, product and project managers, support function roles as well as agricultural specialists. You will ensure a smooth recruitment process and a great candidate experience.
   

  

**Your Role Will Include But Not Be Limited To**
* Collaborate with hiring managers to develop job descriptions and candidate profiles
* Write and publish job ads
* Source, screen, and interview candidates
* Recruitment administration such as candidate communication, referrals, assessments, reference checks, employment contracts
* Collaborate with HR colleagues to ensure a seamless process from recruitment to onboarding
* Participate in employer branding activities


**Qualifications**
 To succeed in this role, we believe you have:
   

  

* Experience managing end-to-end recruitment processes
* Previous experience of recruitment of a wide range of roles
* Knowledge of employment law and regulations that govern the recruitment process
* High proficiency in spoken and written English and Swedish
* Experience working with managers at various levels and backgrounds in a global organization
* Experience using an ATS; familiarity with SAP SuccessFactors is beneficial
* Experience working with assessments; knowledge of Alva Labs is beneficial


 Furthermore, we believe that you are an excellent communicator with strong interpersonal skills, allowing you to build relationships and collaborate effectively. Your ability to stay organized and manage time efficiently ensures smooth workflows. With a curious and positive mindset, and a "can-do" attitude, you embrace challenges and approach tasks with enthusiasm and determination. We naturally expect the highest integrity in this role.
   

  

**Working at DeLaval**
 Our core values Passion, People, Professionals and Partnerships connect individuals across entities and geographies. Success is far more than knowledge – it is strongly related to behaviour. At DeLaval we are all guided by our three behaviours: Set Direction, Make Things Happen and One DeLaval.
   

  

 We offer you a workplace like no other, where state-of-the-art technology goes hand in hand with animal welfare. DeLaval is a part of the Tetra Laval Group together with Tetra Pak and Sidel.
   

  

**In Addition, We Offer**
* Secure employment and benefits from the collective agreement (occupational pension, work-related accident insurance).
* Wellness allowance of SEK 4 000/year.
* Private healthcare insurance.
* Flexible working hours and reduced working hours.
* 30 days paid annual leave.


**Additional Information**
 This is a full-time temporary position for one year, to cover for our colleague who will be going on parental leave. The position is based at DeLaval’s headquarters in Tumba, south of Stockholm. We offer a hybrid and flexible workplace model.
   

  

 We review applications ongoing. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact us.
   

  

**Contact**
 Hiring manager: Valerie Binner, valerie.binner@delaval.com
   

  

 HR Business Partner: Ida Roman, ida.roman@delaval.com
   

  

 HR Business Partner: Elin Fagerstedt, elin.fagerstedt@delaval.com
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions.
   

  

 Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group.
   

  

 See more at corporate.delaval.com

title: Klientspecialist inom Microsoft Endpoint
description:
Vi på Consulting IT söker just nu flera engagerade klientspecialister med expertis inom Microsoft Endpoint till vår kund. Har du 3-5 års erfarenhet inom IT med fokus på Modern Workplace och brinner för att skapa smidiga och säkra digitala arbetsmiljöer? Då är detta en fantastisk möjlighet för dig!
   

  

 I denna roll blir du en nyckelspelare i ett kompetent team som arbetar med drift, design och utveckling av den digitala arbetsplatsen. Du kommer att få arbeta i en dynamisk miljö där innovation och förbättring alltid står i fokus.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter:**
* Fungera som expertsupport för Modern Workplace M365-området.
* Ge teknisk rådgivning och skapa lösningar anpassade efter kundens behov.
* Driva proaktiva förbättringsåtgärder för att optimera leveranser.
* Samverka med team inom infrastruktur, nätverk, kommunikation och säkerhet.
* Delta i transitions- och transformationsprojekt.
* Bidra med operativt arbete och stötta kunder i deras IT-miljö.


**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Erfarenhet av Microsoft Endpoint Manager (Configuration Manager, Autopilot/Intune).
* Kunskap inom applikationspaketering och Endpoint Security (Defender for Endpoint).
* Förståelse för Entra-ID och MDM-lösningar för iOS/Android.
* God förmåga att kommunicera på både svenska och engelska.


**Vem är du?**
 Vi letar efter en person som är:
   

  

* Social, självständig och effektiv i sitt arbetssätt.
* Noggrann och strukturerad, med en passion för IT och problemlösning.
* En teamplayer som gärna samarbetar och hjälper kollegor.
* Ansvarstagande och nyfiken på att utvecklas i sin roll.


**Om CONSULTING it:**
 När du börjar hos oss som konsult på CONSULTING it blir du en del av vår gemenskap. Du får dessutom kollegor runt om i Sverige! Du har en dedikerad konsultchef som stöttar dig och din utveckling. Vi hjälper dig hitta nya vägar genom att prova på nya roller och nya branscher, för oss är det viktigt att du trivs på din arbetsplats. Vi ser till att du hamnar på ett bra bolag under ditt uppdrag och att uppdragen ligger i linje med hur du vill utvecklas framöver. Oavsett vad det blir, står vi bakom dig hela vägen – i ditt nästa, nästa och nästa steg. Gå med i vårt team och ta del av en spännande och utvecklande arbetsmiljö!

title: Sustainability Controller
description:
**About The Role**
 Sustainability is at core of Instabee's business model and we drive it as an integral part of our company vision and strategy. We are now looking for an analytical Sustainability Controller that can lead our sustainability reporting and compliance. You will perform our carbon accounting for internal and external reporting, keep us up to date on regulations such as CSRD, and support strategic sustainability projects.
   

  

**Some Of The Things You Will Do**
* Data collection: Collaborate with internal stakeholders and external suppliers to collect data related to sustainability metrics, e.g., carbon emissions and energy consumption. Ensure quality of data through triangulation.
* Sustainability / carbon accounting: Own the carbon accounting model and logic. Track and analyse sustainability KPIs to monitor progress and identify areas for improvement.
* Reporting: Develop sustainability performance reports and data submissions, e.g., annual sustainability report, EU Taxonomy report, and investor/merchant surveys. Manage external assurance processes for key sustainability disclosures (e.g., carbon accounting verification.
* Compliance with regulations and frameworks: Project lead the implementation of CSRD and double materiality assessment. Stay up to date with existing and coming regulations and industry standards and support the business to proactively manage these.
* Support strategic projects: Support the sustainability team in decision making and impact projects by providing data-driven insights and documentation, e.g., cost benefit analysis.
* Cross-functional collaboration: Engage with internal stakeholders to communicate sustainability performance, assess sustainability risks, and educate on sustainability-related issues. Collaborate with external stakeholders (e.g., regulators, NGOs, industry groups) to align with broader sustainability efforts.
* Continuous improvement and innovation: Develop Instabee accounting and reporting processes to align with best practices in terms of quality and efficiency.


**Your Future Team**
 You will be part of the Global Sustainability team at Instabee, but you will also work very closely with our Operations and other parts of the organization to collect data and communicate sustainability performance and insights. You will report to the Sustainability Project Manager.
   

  

**What We're Looking For**
* 2-4 years of experience in sustainability reporting
* Experience with carbon accounting according to GHG Protocol
* Experience from managing data collection and projects with multiple stakeholders
* Experience from working with large data sets and data bases, driving insights and ensuring data quality
* Understanding of sustainability regulations, experience from working with CSRD and double materiality assessment is a merit
* Self-driven, used to drive your own work, identifying issues and solving them
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, working collaboratively with stakeholders across the organization to achieve shared goals.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, ensuring effective communication. Beneficial with fluency in Swedish.
* University education in a relevant area


*If this is you then we can’t wait to meet you!*
**What You’ll Get**
 We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like changes and want to set new processes and ways of working - this is the place for you!
   

  

**Benefits**
 Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:
   

  

* 🌇 Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
* 🐶 Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
* 🏓 Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
* 👶 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care and love to your little one.
* 🎂 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!m for your leisure time.
* ⏰ Flexible Hours: Hybrid setup with working hours that adapt to your lifestyle.


 Diversity and inclusion is very important to us and we are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We want to be a workplace where everyone’s perspectives and opinions are valued, and we are dedicated to creating opportunities for all employees to thrive and reach their full potential.
   

  

**Get To know Us**
 In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the consumer at heart.
   

  

 We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for you to help us on the journey ahead.

title: Category Manager IC Sweden
company_industry: Manufacturing, Food and Beverage Manufacturing, and Food and Beverage Services
description:
**Looking for Your Dream Job? Join Our Ice Cream Team As Category Manager!**
**Terms & Conditions: Full Time**
 If you are in the Unilever Ice Cream business or consider choosing to work for the Unilever Ice Cream business, you will work for the Global, leading Ice Cream player with €7.9bn Turn Over in 2023. The Ice Cream business is operating in a highly attractive category, as we are part of the 1 trillion snacking and refreshment industry, growing consistently at high pace. We have strong brands equities: 5 of top 10 selling brands including Wall’s, Magnum, Ben &Jerry’s. We are investing to unlock the full growth potential of Ice Cream as a standalone entity, once we separate from Unilever, which is planned to happen by November 2025.
   

  

 Ice Cream has distinct characteristics from Unilever’s other operating businesses and the growth potential of Ice Cream will be better delivered under a different ownership structure. As Ice Cream company we are committed to developing and nurturing talent within our Ice Cream company. You will have ample options for career growth and exploration, allowing you for you to explore roles and opportunities across the new organisation. Your career development will be a priority for us, and we are dedicated to supporting your growth journey within the new company. We hope that you will want to build the new chapter of our Ice Cream history together with us.
   

  

**ABOUT ICE CREAM: Life Tastes Better with Ice Cream**
 Unilever Ice Cream is the largest global Ice Cream Company in the world, with over 100 years of experience delivering a diverse range of indulgent, yet responsible, craft food experiences and treats delighting consumers. Committed to innovation, quality, and sustainability we have 35 brands, including 3 one billion Euro brands (Magnum, Wall’s, Ben & Jerry’s), a strong presence in over 60 countries, generating annual revenue of over $8 billion. All brands are driven to transform moments into memories through indulgent yet responsibly made and marketed products. We have a well-developed strategy to deliver growth and value creation which is clear on where to play and how to win.
   

  

 We turn the ordinary into the extraordinary by designing unique and innovative Ice Cream experiences that make life taste better, creating joyful experiences. In our Ice Cream business, we’re crafting the future through innovation and imaginative minds, creating unique products. We spark moments of happiness for people and within the communities where we operate. However, it is not as simple as it may seem. As Ice Cream makers we are serious about happiness. With warm hearts, we create the coolest products.
   

  

 WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING?
   

  

 In this role, you will be an integral part in building, developing, and maintaining credible, long term, category lead relationships, internal & external. In addition, you will be the voice of the consumer and shopper in the organization delivering actionable insights that deliver category value creation. You will be the expert and turn insights into actions with best-in-class execution, analysis, and evaluation of category plans, managing the end-to-end critical path, to deliver range reviews with customers providing leading edge Category Management solutions.
   

  

 Scope: In-Home Sweden (Grocery Trade)
   

  

 Reports to: CSP Lead Nordic/Sweden
   

  

 Location: Stockholm, SWEDEN
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Utilise the category growth model to develop category understanding and provide actionable insights with our retail partners and drive incremental growth in the category by tailoring the category growth model to the customers by delivering bespoke customer initiatives using a shopper first lens.
* Partner closely with agencies and identify appropriate insights and data sources, Utilize and understand multiple data sources (Nielsen, Kantar, Household Panel, market demographic data, EPOS and loyalty data and systems) to generate recommendations for category & range reviews.
* Bringing the shopper & consumer view to the Ice Cream Business Unit aiding the delivery of Shopper insights and recommendations in the delivery of new innovations, promotional plans, Joint Business Plan building, and price positioning. Understanding how the shopper is shopping the category, identifying opportunities to put Unilever products outside of the main fixture.
* Monitoring implementation and review of range recommendations enabling SKU optimization and optimum product mix. Coordinating the process of launching new products to customers by adapting trade stories and trade presentations to local conditions and needs and delivering key category/customer reporting and ad hoc analysis as required.


**What You Need To Succeed**
 We believe the right person for this role has some years of professional experience from the FMCG industry. Previous experience from working with GfK or Nielsen data is a plus. The ideal candidate is positive, self-going and proactive. You should be able to structure your work and to work with several different tasks and processes simultaneously.
   

  

 You have strong communication skills as you need to be able to express analytics to various levels in the organization; as well as the ability to deliver presentations and training. You also must be able to effectively interact with peers, sales management, and senior management to build sustainable, positive relationships with people on all levels in an organization, both internally and externally. Skills in Microsoft Office, especially Excel, is key.
   

  

*Please note that fluency in Swedish and English is needed for this role.*
**COMPETENCIES**
* A passion for winning with customers in the marketplace
* Ability and desire to present market data in a comprehendible format conveying actionable insights
* Strong communication and people skills with ability to build positive relationships across all levels in an organization, both internally and externally
* Ability to structure your work and to work with several different tasks and processes simultaneously
* Strong project management and planning competencies
* Self-driven, proactive and solution-oriented
* Ability to work independently as well as in teams


**Required Expereince**
* 3-5 years of professional experience from the FMCG industry. Ideally also a university degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Finance or Engineering.
* Previous experience from working with GfK or Nielsen data is a plus, as well as experience in speaking and presenting in front of large groups of people.
* Fluency in local language and English, both speaking and writing
* Excellent knowledge of MS Office (including Excel and Powerpoint)
* Knowledge of Power BI is a plus


**Additional Information**
 Unilever embraces diversity and encourages applicants from all walks of life. This means giving full and fair consideration to all applicants and continuing development of all employees regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, marriage and civil partnership, and pregnancy and maternity.
   

  

 For the recruitment of this position, we would like to emphasize that local conditions apply to the position.
   

  

**ARE YOU EXCITED TO CRAFT THE ICE CREAM FUTURE?**
 To apply, you must do so online. Please do not forget to upload your CV, latest EoY and a motivation letter. If you have been informed that you are at risk of redundancy, please make sure to tick this box during your application. Please also attach your letter of redundancy to the application.
   

  

 Your application will be reviewed against our requirements, and we will be in touch shortly after the closing date to provide you with an update on the status of your application.
   

  

 By applying for this vacancy, you are confirming that you have made your Line Manager aware of your application and that you are at a point in your career with Unilever where it is appropriate for you to apply for other positions.
   

  

 Disclaimer
   

  

 Equal Opportunity Employer: Unilever is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
   

  

 We take pleasure seriously. Join the Ice Cream team now!
   

  

**APPLY TODAY!**
 Submit your application as soon as possible. Please observe that there will be an on-going screening process and that the position can be filled before last application date.
   

  

**CONTACT**
 Should you have questions around the recruitment process, please reach out to Talent Advisor Nordics at ta.nordic@unilever.com
   

  

 Unilever is an organisation committed to equity, inclusion and diversity to drive our business results and create a better future, every day, for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. At Unilever we are interested in every individual bringing their ‘Whole Self’ to work and this includes you! Thus if you require any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of your application so that we can support you through your recruitment journey.

title: 2 x Assistant Manager Go to Market
company_industry: Manufacturing, Retail, and Sporting Goods Manufacturing
description:
Assistant Manager Go-To-Market (Category Manager) Nordics
   

  

 Join adidas and shape the future of the sporting goods industry! For over 75 years, our European heritage has been a fusion of culture and innovation, driving global sports trends. Our European offices, from Herzogenaurach to Stockholm, London, Berlin, Zaragoza, Amsterdam, Warsaw, Athens, Milan, Manchester, and Paris, are centres of creativity and collaboration. We aim to be the best sports brand, seeking pioneers and visionaries to join our bold journey.
   

  

 At adidas, you're not just getting a job; you're invited to make a global impact, joining a team that values creativity, courage and innovation. Are you ready to be part of our journey?
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As our Assistant Go to Market (Category) Manager at adidas Nordics, you’ll support our Go-To-Market team to help drive category specific business & brand success through the development & execution of a robust go-to-market plan, with a consumer centric lens aligned to our Nordic targets.
   

  

 If you’re passionate about adding value and building strong relationships – acting as key contact for all topics within the assigned category, this could be the adidas product role for you. You’ll work closely with both European and local sales & brand teams to secure fully aligned range plans where local needs are fulfilled.
   

  

 We’re looking for our Assistant Go to Market (Category) Manager to be naturally motivated and come with a growth mindset who has recent commercial experience within product marketing or sales. We need someone consumer focused, with an interest in both brand and commercial. You’ll support the Nordic category plan and identify and drive opportunities & needs together with the wider team.
   

  

 Finally, you’re an strong communicator who enjoys presenting on stage and interacting with customers during sell-in with customers. This role reports into the Nordic Director Go to Market.
   

  

**We’re Looking For**
* Functional marketing and/or sales knowledge with strong passion for sports – this is important as you’ll be surrounded by sports topics 24/7 in work.
* Consumer-focused with essential product and range understanding.
* 1-3 years of Merchandising/ Category management Experience, cross-functional marketing and/or sales experience.
* University degree in business, ideally with marketing and sales focus or equivalent professional experience.
* Fluent in English (writing and verbal).
* IT skills: Outlook and Word: Basic; Excel and PowerPoint: advanced.


**Considerations**
* Location/Travel: you will work in our Solna office for 3 days a week, although flexibility & willingness to travel across EU on a monthly level is required.


**Life At Adidas**
 We operate a flexible hybrid model with 3 days in the office (2 fixed days for full collaboration with our colleagues) and the flexibility for you to choose where you work from home on the other 2 days. We also have an optional “Sports Hour” every Thursday @ 11-12, a sports club for you to choose your preferred activity, and an annual fitness allowance.
   

  

 We offer a performance related bonus, 30 days holiday, flexible bank holidays (swap up to 3 bank holidays per year for other days of leave), private health insurance & generous employee discount, public gym & pool facilities.
   

  

 To ensure everyone feels welcome we endeavour to accommodate everyone at all stages of the application and interview process. Should you need it, please let your recruitment partner know and they will be more than happy to help.
   

  

 \*\*Please ensure you upload an English version of your CV and apply before our closing date of 06.05.25\*\*
   

  

 adidas celebrates diversity, supports inclusiveness and encourages individual expression in our workplace. We do not tolerate the harassment or discrimination toward any of our applicants or employees. We are an equal opportunity employer.

title: Systemtekniker IT inom Active Directory
company_industry: Civil Engineering, Government Administration, and Truck Transportation
description:
Vad händer om person, dator eller it-system inte kan autentisera sig eller en person inte har rätt behörighet vid rätt tillfälle? I den här rollen är du en nyckelperson som ser till att våra IAM-system fungerar dygnet runt. Du får jobba nära tekniken och säkra tillgängligheten till våra AD-miljöer som hela Trafikverket är beroende av. Det är ett ansvarsfullt och varierat arbete där din kompetens gör verklig skillnad - varje dag.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Är du en erfaren systemtekniker inom IAM (Identity Access Management), med tyngden inom Active Directory Domain Services, och vill ha nya utmaningar så har vi jobbet för dig! Vi kan erbjuda dig ett roligt, intressant och utvecklande arbete i en stor organisation med flera stora AD-miljöer on prem med krav på tillgänglighet 24/7.
   

  

 Du kommer ingå i ett nationellt team med kompetenta och engagerade kollegor bestående av systemtekniker, systemspecialister och scrummaster inom IAM (Identity Access Management). Totalt är vi 13 personer som tillsammans har ansvar för drift, förvaltning och vidareutveckling av Trafikverkets IT-infrastruktur inom autentisering och auktorisering som omfattar katalog-, certifikat- och federationstjänster samt multifaktorautentisering.
   

  

 Din huvudsakliga arbetsuppgift som systemtekniker är att arbeta med den dagliga driften av våra it-plattformar inom IAM. Arbetet består av att hantera inkomna larm och beställningar samt lösa uppkomna incidenter av bland annat DNS-tjänsten, GPOer, SPNer, certifikat och verifiering av patchningar av våra IAM-servrar. Tillsammans med teamets systemspecialister medverkar du även i förvaltningsaktiviteter och livscykling av våra AD-miljöer. Detta arbete planeras i iterationer enligt agilt arbetssätt.
   

  

 Som systemtekniker kan du komma att få medverka i uppdrag och projekt som sakkunnig inom vårt teknikområde.
   

  

 I tjänsten ingår beredskapstjänstgöring enligt ett rullande schema ca var sjätte vecka.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Som vår nya kollega ser vi att du har god samarbetsförmåga och har lätt för att skapa nya relationer och personliga kontakter. Du har förmåga att arbeta både självständigt och i grupp för att hitta lösningar på uppkomna problem. På ett målmedvetet och strukturerat sätt tar du ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och visar engagemang och intresse till att ta initiativ för att driva din, teamets och leveransens utveckling framåt. Du har god kommunikationsförmåga i både tal och skrift. Arbetet ställer krav på att du är noggrann och har ett högt säkerhetsmedvetande och hanterar förändringsarbete ansvarsfullt. Ditt engagemang och intresse för teknik driver dig, men du har också förmågan att förstå hur Trafikverket har valt att bygga sina lösningar - och varför.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som
   

  

* har en eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT (t.ex. Data-/Systemvetenskap) eller motsvarande kunskaper/utbildning i kombination med erfarenhet som vi bedömer likvärdig
* har flerårig aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av att arbeta med felsökning, drift och löpande förvaltning av Active Directory Domain Services on prem
* har god kännedom om övriga Windows servertjänster
* har förståelse för grundläggande it-infrastruktur
* har erfarenhet av att använda Powershell i dagligt driftarbete
* har goda kunskaper i tal och skrift i svenska och engelska


 Det är meriterande om du
   

  

* har erfarenhet av att arbeta med felsökning och drift av PKI/ADCS, federationstjänst/ADFS och lösningar inom multifaktorautentisering
* har erfarenhet av Linux server
* har erfarenhet av att arbeta enligt ITIL och/eller agila ramverk
* har körkort för personbil


**Övrig information**
 Möjliga placeringsorter för denna tjänst är: Borlänge, Göteborg, Stockholm eller Örebro.
   

  

 Vill du ha en flexibel vardag med möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån? I den här rollen kan du jobba på distans upp till två dagar i veckan.
   

  

 För att undvika att du missar viktig information om din ansökan behöver du se till att hålla dig uppdaterad via "Min karriärsida"! Vi använder främst mail (från mejladress: noreply@heroma.se) för att göra utskick och kallelser. Kolla din inkorg och även skräppost/SPAM regelbundet under denna tid för att vara säker på att du får all information från oss! Du kan med fördel även lägga till den mejladressen i dina mejlkontakter.
   

  

 Anställningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass. För anställning krävs godkänt resultat i säkerhetsprövningen, som genomförs i enlighet med bestämmelser i säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).
   

  

 I denna rekrytering används webbaserade tester som en del i urvalet.
   

  

 Du motiveras av ett aktivt medarbetarskap där du på ett målmedvetet sätt tar ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter samtidigt som du är uppmärksam på hur du är en del av och bidrar till helheten genom att samverka med andra.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 De frågor som du får besvara när du skickar in din ansökan kommer att ligga till grund för det första urvalet vi gör. Om det inte står något annat i annonsen vill vi att du bifogar ditt CV. Vi har slutat begära in personligt brev eftersom vi inte har med det som del av urvalsunderlaget. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ska du kontakta ansvarig chef för rekryteringen så att din ansökan blir hanterad enligt särskilda rutiner. Du hittar namn och kontaktuppgifter till chefen i annonsen.
   

  

 Inom vår IT-organisation är du med och utvecklar Sverige med hjälp av moderna och innovativa lösningar. Vi är mitt i en spännande förändring där vi försöker ta vara på digitaliseringens möjligheter till fullo. Digitaliseringen ställer allt större krav och vi vill därför anpassa oss vad gäller kompetens, arbetssätt och organisation i takt med utvecklingen. Vi har ett helhetsansvar för IT och telekom, en verksamhet som pågår dygnet runt, året om - precis som Sveriges transportsystem.
   

  

 På Trafikverket jobbar vi med att göra Sverige närmare. Vi tror på att en förening av olika erfarenheter, bakgrunder och perspektiv är den bästa grunden för att bygga en arbetsplats fri från diskriminering och en miljö där alla trivs och gör sitt bästa. Vi tror på mångfald där den gemensamma nämnaren är pålitlighet, engagemang och mod. För det är så vi bäst representerar vårt samhälle.

title: Manager Go to Market
company_industry: Manufacturing, Retail, and Sporting Goods Manufacturing
description:
Go-To-Market (Category) Manager | Nordics
   

  

 Join adidas and shape the future of the sporting goods industry! For over 75 years, our European heritage has been a fusion of culture and innovation, driving global sports trends. Our European offices, from Herzogenaurach to Stockholm, London, Berlin, Zaragoza, Amsterdam, Warsaw, Athens, Milan, Manchester, and Paris, are centres of creativity and collaboration. We aim to be the best sports brand, seeking pioneers and visionaries to join our bold journey.
   

  

 At adidas, you're not just getting a job; you're invited to make a global impact, joining a team that values creativity, courage and innovation. Are you ready to be part of our journey?
   

  

**What You'll Do**
 As our Go to Market (Category) Manager at adidas Nordics, you’ll drive and ensure category business & brand success through the development & execution of a robust go-to-market plan with a consumer centric lens, which is aligned to our Nordic targets.

title: Servicemedarbetare till servicecenter NATT
description:
**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Som kundservicemedarbetare på Servicecenter är ditt huvudsakliga uppdrag att på ett säkert och effektivt sätt hantera och kvalitetssäkra ärenden och felanmälningar som inkommer till Servicecenter.
   

  

 På daglig basis innebär arbetet till stor del att du hjälper, vägleder och koordinerar ärenden med både interna och externa kunder, samarbetspartners och leverantörer via mejl och telefon. Detta kräver att du har god känsla för kommunikation och service.
   

  

 Du arbetar på plats på vårt huvudkontor i Hagastaden och ingår i ett team på fyra personer.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Ta emot, registrera och sortera ärenden som rapporteras in till Servicecenter via telefon och e-mail från personal inom MTR.
* Övervakning av larm för stationer.
* Ta emot och registrera sjukskrivningssamtal samt lösa vakanser.
* Support för enkla IT-ärenden.
* Felavhjälpning av ärenden.
* Rapportera i ärendehanteringssystemet.
* Analysera och tolka rapporter.
* Bidra till att utveckla och förbättra avdelningens rutiner och manualer.


 Tjänsten är på heltid och arbetstiderna är 22:00-06:00, med rullande schema inklusive arbete varannan helg.
   

  

 Vi befinner oss i Hagastaden.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Arbetet på Servicecenter ställer höga krav på att kunna arbeta strukturerat i flera parallella processer samtidigt som du ger utmärkt service. Vi söker därför dig som har god erfarenhet av att arbeta med service i miljöer där det händer mycket.
   

  

 Som person är du lösningsorienterad och serviceinriktad. Du har lätt för att sätta dig in i nya uppgifter och har en god problemlösningsförmåga. Då arbetet innebär att hantera många parallella processer och ibland under hög belastning krävs det att du har god stresstålighet.
   

  

 Vidare vill vi att du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att arbeta natt
* Gymnasiekompetens eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet
* Goda datorkunskaper och använder Office-paketet obehindrat
* Erfarenhet av arbete inom kundservice och telefonsupport
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift eftersom en stor del av arbetet innebär skriftlig och muntlig framställa


 Vi önskar tillsätta tjänsten omgående, så observera att vi tillämpar löpande urval!
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Med oss på MTR gör du skillnad i människors vardag och för samhället omkring oss. Vi utmanar gamla sanningar och hittar nya lösningar för att utveckla oss själva och de samhällen där vi finns. Det har gjort oss till ett av världens ledande tågbolag. Våra värderingar är den röda tråden i vårt dagliga arbete: utmärkt service, ömsesidig respekt, ständig utveckling och mätbara resultat. De hjälper oss att skapa säkra resor, nöjda kunder och medarbetare som trivs. Vi är ett stort bolag vilket ger dig ett brett nätverk och möjligheter att utvecklas.
   

  

 Förmåner
   

  

 Som anställd hos MTR får du en rad förmåner, som SL-kort med resor i hela Stockholms län och Ticket Rikskortet till förmånsbeskattning. Förutom friskvårdsbidrag kan vi även erbjuda rabatter hos flera träningsanläggningar och företag inom friskvård.
   

  

 Vill du arbeta tillsammans med oss på MTR?
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan i form av ett CV och besvara ett antal urvalsfrågor. Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Namn, Titel, via förnamn.efternamn@mtr.se. Ansökan sker via vår hemsida, vi har inte möjlighet att ta emot ansökningar via e-post.
   

  

 Urval och intervjuer sker löpande. Som ett led i rekryteringen använder vi oss av urvalstester.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Om MTR**
 MTR är en av världens främsta operatörer för järnvägsbunden trafik och har sin bas i Hongkong. I Sverige är vi över 3500 kollegor som driver tunnelbanan, fordonsunderhållsbolaget MTR Tech och MTR Facility Management. Vårt uppdrag är att underlätta människors vardag och länka samman och utveckla hållbara samhällen.
   

  

 För mer information om MTR besök www.mtrnordic.se .
   

  

**Anställningens omfattning**
 Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning
   

  

 Omfattning: Heltid
   

  

 Tillträde: 2025-05-22
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Ansök senast: 2025-05-09
   

  

 Referensnummer: C250522
   

  

**Anställning**
 Antal annonserade arbetstillfällen: 1
   

  

**Kontakt**
**Kontaktpersoner**
* Joanna Gulbrandsen


 Mail: Joanna.gulbrandsen@mtr.se

title: SAP Technical Architect
company_industry: Paper and Forest Product Manufacturing and Packaging and Containers Manufacturing
description:
**Job Description**
 At Billerud we believe that when we have tomorrow in mind, we will do our very best today. It is thanks to our employees that we are a world-leading company within the field of renewable paper and packaging materials. Do you want to realize your true value and work for a sustainable tomorrow? Join us!
   

  

 Become a Key Player as an
 **SAP Technical Architect** 
 at Billerud.
   

  

 Are you ready to take on a key role in a stable yet evolving industry? Billerud has recently launched a group-wide program that will modernize and harmonize our working methods, which includes introducing a new ERP system. As our SAP Technical Architect, you will bring expert knowledge in SAP RISE, SAP S/4HANA, SAP BTP and cloud technologies and ensuring that the systems are secure, compliant and integrated with other enterprise applications.
   

  

 We are seeking a highly skilled SAP Technical Architect to join our Global IT Shared Applications team. The successful candidate will be responsible for the overall SAP architecture and technical solutions, ensuring they align with business objectives. This role involves managing all technical aspects of SAP modules and overseeing the deployment and integration of SAP solutions.
   

  

**In This Role, You Will Be Responsible For**
* Develop and maintain the overall SAP system architecture.
* Guide teams through technical challenges and ensure best practices are followed.
* Oversee the deployment of SAP solutions, including configuration and integration with other systems.
* Ensure seamless integration of SAP systems with other enterprise applications and technologies.
* Collaborate closely with internal staff, project teams, and external vendors.
* Investigate the feasibility of integrations and work closely with the Application Manager.
* Document the solution architecture in line with given standards.
* Understand the current system landscape and integrations to support our transition.
* Provide expertise and context for Billerud's SAP solutions.
* Travel is required for the role.


**We are looking for multiple SAP experts, don't miss our other vacancies such as:**
 At Billerud, we put Safety First. Together we take great pride in our responsibility to contribute to a safe work environment. Please read more about our Safety First initiative
   

  

**Qualifications**
 To succeed in the role of
 **SAP Technical Architect** 
 , we believe you have:
   

  

* Degree in IT, Computer Science, or Computer Engineering.
* Expert knowledge in SAP, especially SAP RISE, SAP S/4HANA and SAP BTP.
* Knowledge of cloud technologies, such as Microsoft Azure.
* Solid experience with SAP implementations and technical proficiency with at least 2 full cycle SAP implementations.
* Knowledge of SAP security concepts, user roles, and compliance standards.
* Proficiency in integrating SAP systems with other enterprise applications.
* Ability to work in a cross-functional environment and collaborate effectively.
* Mastery of English, both spoken and written.


**You will be based at any of our sites in Sweden such as Gävle, Gruvön, Frövi, Skärblacka, Karlsborg or Stockholm, Solna. Travels to our headquarter in Solna will occur.**
 We don’t offer relocation packages, and a Swedish work permit is requested for this position.
   

  

**Personal qualities**
 To thrive in this position, you are a proactive and skilled SAP Technical Architect with strong analytical skills to troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues. Effective communication is key for you, as you explain technical concepts clearly and collaborate with internal staff, project teams, and external vendors. You work well in a cross-functional environment, contributing positively to team dynamics. Adaptability is important to you, as you are comfortable working in a global environment and able to adapt to different cultures and work styles.
   

  

 Our values are very important for us and we believe that you recognize yourself in: We care for each other and We do what we say.
   

  

**Contact**
 If you would like to know more about the position, please contact Katarina Kopkin, Senior Manager Global IT Shared Applications, at katarina.kopkin@billerud.com. For more information about the recruitment process, please contact Julia Åkerlund, Talent Acquisition Partner, at julia.akerlund@billerud.com.
   

  

 We kindly decline offers from external recruitment providers.
   

  

**Application information**
 Welcome with your application no later than 2025-05-13.  Selection may take place on an ongoing basis during this process.
   

  

 Billerud is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.
   

  

**Why us?**
* Join both a local and global team of skilled professionals!An opportunity to contribute to a more sustainable future
* Development and career opportunities
* Performance-based bonus, occupational pension and a number of different benefits according to company policy.
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard.


**Our recruitment process** 
 will include interviews, recruitment test, reference checks, alcohol- & drug test as well as background checks.
   

  

**Do you want to help create a sustainable future through your work?**
 At Billerud, we are fully committed to reduce our and our customers carbon footprint by offering high-performance paper and packaging materials. We are convinced that the right solutions can be important tools to help fight climate change. That's why we see it as our responsibility to enable the best packaging choices, for a better tomorrow.
   

  

 Our proud history in the forestry and paper industry goes back more than 150 years. Since then, we’ve grown to what we are today: a world leading company in high-performing paper and packaging materials - passionately committed to sustainability, quality, and customer value. Our materials are the basis of packaging and paper products used by millions of people around the world, 24 hours a day, all year round.
   

  

 We serve customers in more than 100 countries through our three business areas Liquid Packaging Board, Paper and Paper Board. Our nine production units are located in Sweden, USA, and Finland and we have around 6,000 employees in 19 countries. Our annual turnover is approximately SEK 41.2 billion and the share is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. At Billerud we always put safety first, care for each other, and do what we say.
   

  

**Join us in redefining sustainable packaging and drive meaningful change for a better tomorrow.**

title: Konsult - Chef inom Data & Insikt IT i Stockholm
description:
**Vi söker för kunds räkning, som verkar inom E-handel, en konsult / interim till rollen Chef Data & Insikt inom IT i Stockholm.**
 Vi söker en interim / konsult till rollen som Chef inom Data & Insikt hos en välkänd aktör inom e-handelsområdet. Uppdraget är på heltid, startar så snart som möjligt och förväntas pågå under en längre period.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
 I detta konsultuppdrag får du ta ett strategiskt och operativt ansvar för data, analys och insikt – med målet att skapa tydligt affärsvärde. En roll för dig som vill påverka, leda och utveckla – i en verksamhet där behovet av datadrivet beslutsstöd står i centrum.
   

  

**Det här gör du hos oss**
* Ge strategiskt stöd till ledningsgrupp och andra beslutsfattare i frågor kopplade till data, analys och styrning.
* Ansvara för utveckling, förvaltning och optimering av verksamhetens rapporter och dashboards i Power BI.
* Utveckla och förvalta ramverk och processer för Data Governance i nära samarbete med övriga delar av organisationen.
* Fatta beslut om metoder, verktyg och arbetssätt inom dataanalys, rapportering och Data Governance.
* Ansvara för att organisera och leda enhetens dagliga arbete.
* Föreslå och genomföra utvecklingsinitiativ inom ramen för enhetens uppdrag och mål.
* Ha fullt personalansvar för medarbetare inom enheten, inklusive rekrytering, kompetensutveckling och arbetsmiljö.
* Företräda enheten i interna och externa sammanhang.
* Agera rådgivande till ledningsgrupp i frågor som rör data och insikt.


**Ditt team och arbetsplats**
 Du kliver in i en ny roll med ansvar för att bygga upp både team och struktur från grunden. Det finns en ambition att forma en enhet med rätt kompetens för att driva data- och analysområdet framåt – exakt utformning görs tillsammans med dig. Du arbetar nära ledning, IT och verksamhet. Uppdraget är placerat i Stockholm.
   

  

**Mer om dig**
* Flerårig erfarenhet av Power BI, både utveckling och förvaltning.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att arbeta med eller etablera Data Governance.
* Tidigare haft ledar- och personalansvar, gärna i analytiska eller tekniska team.
* God förståelse för datamodellering, databashantering och ETL.
* Erfarenhet av förändringsledning kopplat till datadrivna arbetssätt och beslutsstöd.
* God systemförståelse och insikt i relevanta BI-plattformar, datalager, integrationer och rapporteringsmiljöer.
* Akademisk examen inom relevant område t.ex. systemvetenskap, statistik, dataanalys, ekonomi eller teknik.


**Så här får vi kontakt**
 Detta är ett konsultuppdrag där du antingen blir anställd av oss på Ada Digital eller anlitas som underkonsult, beroende på vilken lösning som passar dig bäst. I tillsättningen strävar vi efter att ge dig en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Och vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! För att ansöka behöver du inte bifoga några dokument. Skriv istället en kort motivering och bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Urval kommer sker löpande och uppdraget kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Head of People (Cloud & Software Services)
description:
**About the Opportunity:**
 Ericsson Cloud Software & Services (BCSS) provides industry-leading solutions for Core Network and Automation, Managed Services, Services Orchestration, and Telecom BSS. We enable communication service providers to transition to cloud-native software and automated operations, preparing their networks for the future. We’re a global team of 31,000 operating in many countries supporting our global customers across 180 geographies.
   

  

 Reporting to the Head of BCSS, the Head of People BCSS is accountable to create and implement the BCSS People Strategy to support the achievement of our business strategy. The Head of BCSS People takes decisions on how we best attract, develop, manage, and retain the talent needed across all global sites to execute on our business strategy. This role will advise and collaborate with the Head of BCSS and the BCSS leadership team to create strategies that address challenges related to external factors such as technological changes and geopolitics, as well as internal factors such as shifts in capabilities and site strategies. These efforts are essential for BCSS's success.
   

  

 The Head of People BCSS will be part of both the BCSS and Ericsson Global People leadership teams. Working in a matrix structure, this position requires strong stakeholder management and influencing skills. Additionally, with EGI organization being within BCSS, the Head of BCSS People will ensure that our People Strategy in India matches what India market requires to attract and retain the best talent.
   

  

 The location of this role is preferably at our headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden. At Ericsson, we follow an office-first approach, so most of your time will be spent working face-to-face with colleagues in the office.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Collaborate closely with the BCSS Leadership team and global People team to identify key people priorities and develop and implement solutions to address these, while adhering to high standards of ethics and compliance.
* Support the Head of BCSS as a trusted advisor and challenger, offering recommendations to drive change within the organization, raising the bar on both performance and leadership.
* Develop, and when needed, quickly adapt our strategic people direction, referencing our breadth of operations, strengths, challenges, opportunities, and geographic characteristics, and translate these into an effective people strategy.
* Build and lead a strong BCSS People organization, acting as advisors and coaches to align employee efforts with the broader BCSS organization's business strategy.
* Lead the creation and execution of the People Strategy for Ericsson India, ensuring we remain a top choice for talented individuals in India.
* Manage relationships with Global People Heads across different organizational dimensions to ensure strong collaboration while ensuring BCSS’s needs are addressed in the Global People strategy and initiatives.


**What you will bring:**
 Key Attributes:
   

  

* Excellence in working with people and an aptitude to motivate, engage, develop listen to and inspire the team.
* Execute and drive continuous change based on customer feedback, employee input and feedback as well as global improvement programs.
* Role model courageous leadership; curious and willing to challenge the status quo.
* Excellent coaching skills, ability to foster and maintain strong relationships across the organization.
* Experienced in navigating complexity and ambiguity.
* Ability and experience of managing multi country, diverse teams, and cultures, and within a matrix structure.
* Effective communication, collaboration, problem-solving and analytical skills.
* High integrity with a strong focus on compliance and the ability to foster a speak-up culture.


 Leadership:
   

  

* Creates clarity (decision making, delegation, strategic leadership, impact & influence, active listening, emotional intelligence) .
* Develops people (constructive feedback, coaching, empathetic, employee motivation) .
* Deliver results (accountability, performance review, leading & developing high performing teams, adaptability, resilience & perseverance, team motivation) .


 Minimum Requirements:
   

  

* A bachelor’s degree or higher in Human Resources, Business Administration or Social Sciences or a related discipline.
* Senior experience in Human Resources leadership, with reasonable large leadership responsibility, preferably in diverse businesses and cultural/geographic settings.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 762763
   

  

 ]]>

title: Business Development & Growth Team [AUGUST]
job_function: Information Technology, Business Development, and Sales
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Software Development
description:
Our Business Development & Growth-team will be growing in
 **August** 
**2025** 
 .
 



  





**Come work with us** 




 Netlight strives to be a truly diverse, equitable and inclusive organization. Regardless of who you are, what personality, background, and experience you have, you enrich our culture through your values. Netlight’s purpose is to unleash full potential, realize great careers, and fulfill personal growth. To achieve this, we have a highly engaged network organization, where every employee gets a mentor, delivery coach and personal communities. The key to our continued success is trust and personal responsibility, diverse experiences, challenging opportunities and developing from personal values. Every Netlighter is an active part of building and shaping this culture, which leads to a clear correlation between personal growth and the growth of Netlight.
 



  





**About us** 




 Netlight provides a full range of premium IT-consulting services at the forefront of the digital industry and stands out for its product- and technology-independent expertise in a wide range of industries and clients. We are a network organization of more than 2 000 role models making aspiring digital leaders successful in their business-critical IT projects. Netlight has been awarded several times as top employer, as well as for growth, continued profitability and engagement for diversity, equity and equality within the IT industry. Today we are growing all across Europe, currently with more than 10 active international offices.
 



  





**The role** 




 At Netlight, people are the business. Our continued success depends on our ability to grow with the right individuals—those who challenge, inspire, and build our future. We’re now looking for a new colleague to our People & Growth team to take on one of the most central responsibilities in our company: driving growth by recruiting the best people to Netlight.
 



  





 You will lead and own the full journey of every recruitment process—from first conversation to a successful start—with high exposure across the organization. You’ll work closely with consultants and leadership to understand what the business needs next, and make it happen. The work is hands-on, analytical, project driven, people-centric and business-critical.
 



  





 As part of the people & Growth team on the long term, you’ll also contribute to Netlight’s development in areas like mentorship, retention, our value proposition, and themes such as equality and culture.
 



  





 You’re not here to fill roles—you’re here to build the company.
 



  





**Requirements** 



* Graduate in 2024 or 2025.
* Master's degree / Engineering degree.
* Verbal and written fluency in Swedish and English.
* Passion for people, recruitment, project management, leadership, and the tech industry.
* Experience in relevant areas to the role is a merit, but not a prerequisite, eg. recruitment, headhunting, sales, project management, and networking.



  





**We offer** 



* A possibility to be a core part of growing one of the most successful IT-consultancy companies in the industry (ranked as #1 top employer in Sweden for three consecutive years).
* Working closely with your colleagues in the talent management team of 20 people, driving the future of recruitment, talent management, and growth.
* Personal development is our very core. Besides being a vital part of our high-performing team, our culture of knowledge sharing, and continuous feedback, you will also receive personal mentorship and a senior team member as your coach.
* An inspiring, international working environment in our flat network organization.
* A competitive salary and salary development, long-term career development, and benefits.



  





**Application Process** 




 Are you up for the challenge to be a change catalyst, and together with a market-leading recruitment team, drive future growth at Netlight?
 



  





 Before applying, carefully read through the qualifications. We will get in touch if we find that your profile matches our requirements. To increase your chances, make sure to add a personalized cover letter.

title: Head of Investor Relations & Financing
description:
**About the Position** 




  





 As
 **Head of Investor Relations & Financing** 
 at Sting, you play a pivotal role at the intersection of our startups and the investor ecosystem, including angel investors, family offices, and venture capital firms. You are a relationship-driven, people-oriented professional with high integrity—likely a founder yourself, having firsthand experience with fundraising and learning through doing. You are the "spider in the web," with unparalleled matchmaking skills and a passionate drive to help founders secure their first financing rounds. Reporting directly to the CEO, you are instrumental in ensuring Sting continues to defend its reputation as one of the best startup accelerators in the world.
 



  





**Running Sting’s Financing & Raise Track** 




 With your expertise, you will guide entrepreneurs through the intricacies of fundraising. You will design and lead workshops, sharing practical strategies on how to raise funds, and provide educational content that demystifies the financing landscape. You’ll help founders understand how revenue, soft financing, and fundraising interact, continuously improving the aspects of our program that relate to financing support. You will ensure that sessions run smoothly and collaborate with others as needed.
 



  





**Domain Expertise & Case-by-Case Support** 




 From drafting multi-year financing strategies for startups to proofreading term sheets and facilitating investor introductions, you provide hands-on, case-specific support. You will host office hours and be available for founders who are closing their first investment rounds. While your primary focus is on current program participants, you will also offer support to alumni founders when possible.
 



  





**Investor Relationship Management** 




 Your outstanding social skills and integrity have made you well-connected within the Stockholm, Nordic, and European investor networks. You stay updated on who is looking for which types of investments and excel at matchmaking founders with the right investors. Your close relationship with Sting’s portfolio of 299+ companies positions you as the best possible door opener for our startups.
 



  





**Supporting the Next Generation of Angel Investors** 




 Sting isn’t just about looking after our own startups—it’s also about nurturing the broader Swedish startup ecosystem. In your role, you will support new angel investors entering the field and collaborate closely with Propel Capital, our angel investor network.
 



  





**Events & Investor Engagement** 




 Internally, you’ll co-host demo days, welcome investors, and manage other investor-related activities, such as Beer & Pitch. Externally, you will represent Sting at key global events like Slush and Techarenan, continuously expanding our investor network worldwide.
 



  





**Investment & Financing Administration** 




 You will ensure that our founders have access to up-to-date investor information and relevant resources. This includes managing investor relations partnerships, ensuring legal compliance, and overseeing any partnerships or licenses related to investment and financing (e.g., legal partners).
 



  





**Qualifications** 




  





**Relationship Builder** 
 : You thrive in social settings and excel at operating at the crossroads of investors, entrepreneurs, and partners.
 



**Fundraising Experience** 
 : Previous fundraising experience is a significant plus, as it helps you empathize with the emotional journey of founders and the challenges they face during the process.
 



**Experienced** 
 : You have 5+ years of experience as a startup founder, investor, or portfolio manager, and have honed your ability to combine relationship-building with critical analytical thinking.
 



**Win-Win Mindset** 
 : You are always looking for mutually beneficial partnerships and solutions that work for all parties involved.
 



**Integrity** 
 : You understand that working at the heart of innovation means handling sensitive legal and financial information with care and confidentiality.
 



**Hands-On & Humble** 
 : You’re a doer who’s willing to roll up your sleeves. Whether it’s setting up a cap table session for a scientist or designing new tools for the program, you do what it takes to meet the needs of the founders.
 



**Structured & Deadline-Oriented** 
 : You know how to manage your time, keep deadlines, and guide others to do the same.
 



**Tech-Savvy** 
 : You’re comfortable using tools like HubSpot and are proficient in both Swedish and English (as our internal team language is Swedish).
 



  





**What Sting Offers** 



* A challenging and rewarding role within the vibrant startup ecosystem.
* The opportunity to develop and shape the investor relations and financing support functions at Sting.
* A supportive work environment that fosters personal and professional growth.
* The chance to work at one of Europe’s leading startup accelerators, supporting startups that aim to improve the world and reshape the future.
* A brilliant team of experienced entrepreneurs and business leaders.
* A fun, fast-paced, and dynamic workplace environment.

title: 3 x Senior Manager Go to Market
company_industry: Manufacturing, Retail, and Sporting Goods Manufacturing
description:
Senior Manager Go-To-Market | Nordics
   

  

 Join adidas and shape the future of the sporting goods industry! For over 75 years, our European heritage has been a fusion of culture and innovation, driving global sports trends. Our European offices, from Herzogenaurach to Stockholm, London, Berlin, Zaragoza, Amsterdam, Warsaw, Athens, Milan, Manchester, and Paris, are centres of creativity and collaboration. We aim to be the best sports brand, seeking pioneers and visionaries to join our bold journey.
   

  

 At adidas, you're not just getting a job; you're invited to make a global impact, joining a team that values creativity, courage and innovation. Are you ready to be part of our journey?
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As our Senior Go to Market (Category) Manager at adidas Nordics, you will drive and ensure category business & brand success through the development & execution of an optimal go-to-market plan with a consumer centric lens and aligned to the Nordic targets.
   

  

 We’re looking for people with a Product background to be considered for this role; as you’ll be extremely hands-on with our product assortment, delivering commercial input to serve our consumer and customer needs. You’ll own the Nordic category plan and will identify and drive opportunities & needs relying on market analytics with a marketplace mindset.
   

  

 We need a solid relationship builder, as you’ll act as key contact for all topics within the assigned category and will work closely with European and local sales & brand teams to secure fully aligned GTM plans where local needs are fulfilled.
   

  

 We believe you are a excellent communicator who enjoys presenting and interacting with big groups as you will play a key role in the full GTM process- from concept input to sales launches and seasonal sell-ins with customers. This role reports into the Nordic Director Go to Market.
   

  

**We’re Looking For**
* Preferably Sporting Goods and/or fashion industry background. Passion for sports is a must.
* Consumer-focused with deep product and range understanding with a strong understanding of balancing brand and commercial aspects to build channel specific GTM solutions
* 5+ years of Merchandising/ Category management Experience, cross-functional marketing and/or sales experience.
* University degree in business, ideally with marketing and sales focus or equivalent professional experience.
* IT skills: Outlook and Word: Basic; Excel and PowerPoint: advanced.
* Fluent in English - written & verbal


**Considerations**
* Location/Travel: you will work in our Solna office for 3 days a week, although flexibility & willingness to travel across EU on a monthly level is required.


**Life At Adidas**
 We operate a flexible hybrid model with 3 days in the office (2 fixed days for full collaboration with our colleagues) and the flexibility for you to choose where you work from home on the other 2 days. We also have an optional “Sports Hour” every Thursday @ 11-12, a sports club for you to choose your preferred activity, and an annual fitness allowance.
   

  

 We offer a performance related bonus, 30 days holiday, flexible bank holidays (swap up to 3 bank holidays per year for other days of leave), private health insurance & generous employee discount, public gym & pool facilities.
   

  

 To ensure everyone feels welcome we endeavour to accommodate everyone at all stages of the application and interview process. Should you need it, please let your recruitment partner know and they will be more than happy to help.
   

  

 Please ensure you upload an English version of your CV and apply before our closing date of 06.05.25
   

  

 adidas celebrates diversity, supports inclusiveness and encourages individual expression in our workplace. We do not tolerate the harassment or discrimination toward any of our applicants or employees. We are an equal opportunity employer.

title: Online Marketing Manager
description:
Ready to drive GANT's growth and ignite our Brand and DTC strategy?
 



 GANT stands as an emblem of American Sportswear, symbolizing timeless style and innovation across 70+ global markets. As a company, we blend heritage with contemporary flair, crafting apparel for the bold, the curious, and the imaginative. Our brand represents more than fashion; it's a tradition of excellence and authenticity. As an employer, we foster a culture of continuous learning and creativity, inviting high performers to join our diverse team of innovators. At GANT, we're not just shaping the future of fashion; we're redefining what it means to dress with purpose and passion.
 



 The Online Marketing Manager will play a pivotal role in building brand awareness while securing more than half of the traffic to GANT's digital flagship. Based at Stockholm HQ, this role leads the global team responsible for digital paid media across all channels, as well as Performance Marketing and Search.
 



 Reporting directly to the Global Head of Online Marketing and Loyalty, the Online Marketing Manager will work closely with E-commerce and Brand leadership, as well as Regional Managers.
 


* Manage and develop a team of social media and performance marketing specialists, while overseeing the global digital paid marketing budget to drive brand demand and grow new and existing customers
* Partner with Brand and GTM teams to maximize campaign reach and interest, and collaborate with HQ and regional stakeholders on budget allocation, strategy, and performance to optimize full-funnel opportunities
* Develop and execute agile digital marketing strategies and activation plans, ensuring activities support KPIs such as NCA, revenue, ROAS/CoS, CAC, traffic, and brand awareness
* Set up, optimize, and manage campaigns using platform-based and third-party tools like Meta Ads Manager, Google Ads Manager, and Smartly, while enhancing execution through marketing technologies such as feed management, audience syndication, tracking, and visualization
* Collaborate on the conceptualization of creatives and content for social media marketing channels, ensuring alignment with campaign goals and performance metrics
* Use attribution modeling, data insights, and customer behavior analysis to optimize the consumer journey, boost conversion rates, maximize ROI, and identify new growth strategies to test, optimize, and scale


* BSc/BA or MSc/MA in a business or marketing-related field
* 5-6 years of experience managing paid social and search channels, with expertise in Meta and Google, and familiarity with TikTok, Pinterest, Snapchat, YouTube, and Affiliates
* Proven experience in managing bought media directly, with strong B2B experience
* Strong leadership skills, with a track record of developing teams, setting goals, and driving results
* A forward-thinking strategist with a comprehensive brand mindset, adept at leveraging a test-and-learn approach while staying at the forefront of evolving digital marketing trends.
* Proactive, accountable, with a structured and clear path approach, and fluent in English


  


 Apply with your CV and motivation in English
 **by 2025/05/05** 
 . Our team reviews applications on a rolling basis, so seize the opportunity to join us by submitting your application today!
 *Please note that the position may be filled before the set end date.*

title: ERP Owner Business Central
job_function: Accounting/Auditing, Business Development, and Information Technology
description:
**A Powerful Partnership** 




 St1 Biokraft is a joint venture between St1, HitecVision, and Aneo, combining expertise and resources to drive innovation in the biogas industry. The aim is to become a leading integrated biogas player in the Nordics, contributing significantly to the energy transition. The company covers the entire biogas value chain, from feedstock sourcing to distribution and end-user sales, with a goal to achieve 3 TWh biomethane production and 6 TWh biomethane sales by 2030, focusing on heavy transport, maritime, and industrial applications.
 



 To support this expansion, over 1 billion EUR will be invested in biogas production and distribution networks across the Nordics, with several major projects already underway, aimed at enhancing the infrastructure and scaling up operations to meet ambitious targets.
 



  





**ERP Owner – Business Centra** 
 l
 **St1 Biokraft** 




  





 Do you want to be part of developing and optimizing business systems in a company driving the transition towards a more sustainable future? St1 Biokraft is now looking for an ERP Owner – Business Central who will play a key role in supporting and developing our ERP environment and related processes
 **.** 




  





**About the Role** 




 As the ERP Owner, you will support and enhance Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central (BC) and its integrations. You will act as a crucial connection between users, our ERP partner team and other key players in IT, ensuring the system effectively and sustainably meets business requirements.
 



  





**Your Responsibilities** 



* iSupport & User Assistance
* First-line support for BC users
* Managing users, permissions, and access (BC and ExFlow).
* Administration & System Management
* Overall system management in cooperation with Partners, incl. version upgrade coordination
* Managing the company structure in BC
* Managing existing integrations
* Job queue monitoring and scheduling.
* Development & Improvement Projects
* Driving development together with our ERP partner – requirements specification and testing.
* Leading continuous development and specific projects, such as accounting transitions from acquired companies
* Implementing new integrations and functionalities within BC and other new St1 Biokraft IT system landscape components.



  





**We are looking for someone who has** 



* Extensive experience in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central, with a strong background in pre-sales, integrations, requirements gathering, and implementation.
* Experience in other Finance systems is considered an advantage.
* A proven track record of ERP implementations and BC projects across various industries, particularly in manufacturing and production.
* Strong financial expertise, including accounts receivable/payable, invoicing and financial reporting. Understanding of Project and Fixed assets modules is considered an advantage.
* Technical proficiency in Power BI and Power Automate, along with knowledge of CE/CRM solutions are considered as advantage.
* Experience working with ISV solutions, especially ExFlow.
